Articles.Content:
I'm not necessarily a Star Trek buff, but I recently made an Enterprise-A Probe with over 5000m/s of ÃŽâ€v, A TWR of 0.19, virtually no torque, and good sized battery+generators. It's mainly a useless aesthetic thing, but I suppose that you could slap a few science experiments and transmitter on it. Maybe even an external command seat ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Some pre-taken images (Actually from an older craft version. I was just too lazy to do it all again):

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/YQ4xB)

Sketchfab model:

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

[EnterpriseA Probe v3](https://sketchfab.com/models/ca0d9b3a67314bb9a5945bd2fe41ae8f) by [NeatCrown](https://sketchfab.com/neatcrown) on [Sketchfab](https://sketchfab.com)

[Download](http://www./download/jsoucb6x8kivdbz/EnterpriseA+Probe+v3.craft)

P.S. Just a heads up: It's very unstable when trying to bring it up to orbit without a fairing

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-01T09:07:58Z" title="07/01/2015 09:07  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 1, 2015</time> by NeatCrown**
